programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Dive in Tokyo
programme.sub-title: Nakano - From Dog Sanctuary to Anime Wonderland
programme.desc: Home to manga, anime and toy stores, the Nakano neighborhood is famous for its subculture spirit. As we explore, we discover its rich past as a dog sanctuary, blossom-viewing spot and military hub.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: KABUKI KOOL
programme.desc: Love for family and romance are central themes in the story of many female characters in kabuki. Studio guest and Onnagata actor Nakamura Kazutaro reveals techniques he uses on stage.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Fashioning One-of-a-Kind Costumes: Ito Satomi / Costume Designer
programme.desc: Ito Satomi has designed costumes for many top-tier figure skaters from Japan and overseas. She shares her passion and inspiration for her craft.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: Water Jet Cutters.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Crafting the Ultimate Kitchen Knife: Kurosaki Yu / Blacksmith
programme.desc: Kurosaki Yu is a blacksmith specializing in Echizen cutlery, a 700-year-old Japanese craft. His knives are sought after by chefs in Japan and overseas. He talks about achieving ultimate sharpness.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: National Parks of Japan
programme.desc: Akan-Mashu National Park is located in Japan's northernmost prefecture of Hokkaido. It's home to Lake Akan, Lake Kussharo and Lake Mashu, 3 unique lakes formed by repeated volcanic activity. Join us as we take in its stunning winter sights and learn about the indigenous Ainu culture, which was influenced by the surrounding nature.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: We break down a print that warps space to allow the viewer to be in 2 places at once: Shinobazu Pond, known for its lotus flowers, and the Sumida River, one of Edo's busiest waterways.

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: The Dream of Generative AI Engineering - Koji Nishiguchi, Nagoya University
programme.desc: Research is ongoing to apply 3D generative AI to structural design. Koji Nishiguchi of Nagoya University is on the frontline, with a simulation method which used to be thought of as impractical.

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS
programme.desc: Mongolia's culture of meat-eating is contributing to health problems in this developing economy. Chef Suzuki Yuko aims to introduce more vegetables through workshops and improved hospital menus.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Walnuts have long been valued in Japan. In a major production area, join a wild harvest using bamboo poles and recreate an ancient meal. Back in Tokyo, enjoy walnut dishes at a renowned restaurant. Reporter: Kailene Falls

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.sub-title: Festival Horses: Galloping for the Deities in Shinto Rituals
programme.desc: Horses take center stage in the ancient capital's events, such as two May festivals—Aoi Matsuri boasting ornate historical attire and the 1,200-year-old Fujinomori-sai.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.sub-title: Amazon on the Brink: Global Impact of Deforestation
programme.desc: Deforestation is ravaging the Amazon. Illegal loggers are destroying wide tracts of forest and massive agricultural corporations are buying up land to develop into farms. Scientists warn we are fast approaching a tipping point beyond which the forest's collapse will be irreversible. If this happens, they say there will be serious consequences on global climate and food supply. We talk to experts about the last-ditch efforts to save the world's largest rainforest and what we can do to play our part. Guests: Ito Akihiko (Professor, The University of Tokyo) Fuma Kenji (CEO, Neural)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: First broadcast on December 14, 2023. In the late 19th century, writer Lafcadio Hearn (Japanese name: Koizumi Yakumo) helped introduce Japan to the wider world. We visit the Izumo area to learn about the supernatural realm that he loved.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.desc: Walnuts have long been valued in Japan. In a major production area, join a wild harvest using bamboo poles and recreate an ancient meal. Back in Tokyo, enjoy walnut dishes at a renowned restaurant. Reporter: Kailene Falls

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Outside in Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Historian and author Dr. Barak Kushner is on a quest to deepen his knowledge of Japan's ramen culture. From postwar noodle stalls to regional ramen, he uncovers how a humble bowl became a global icon.

programme.title: NHK NEWS 7
programme.desc: News 7 is NHK's flagship domestic evening news program, bringing you the latest from our Tokyo studio. It's presented with English audio on NHK World for our international viewers

programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.sub-title: Festival Horses: Galloping for the Deities in Shinto Rituals
programme.desc: Horses take center stage in the ancient capital's events, such as two May festivals—Aoi Matsuri boasting ornate historical attire and the 1,200-year-old Fujinomori-sai.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: The Magician of Light: Matsuo Takahiro / Artist
programme.desc: Matsuo Takahiro has gained international recognition for installations that fuse light with cutting-edge technology. He talks about how he creates his one-of-a-kind light art.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Japanese festival favorite, yakisoba! Noodles cooked in a special sauce. Enjoy local yakisoba from all over Japan!

programme.title: National Parks of Japan
programme.desc: Towada-Hachimantai National Park was shaped through volcanic activity. It comprises a mystical lake, a nature-filled gorge and numerous marshes. Nature and humans have worked hand in hand to preserve this natural heritage, showcase Lake Towada's imposing beauty, and restore the bloom to Mt. Hachimantai's marshland.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Japan is a seismically active land; the Edo period was no exception. In the aftermath of a major 1855 earthquake, an angry guardian deity sets off on a quest to capture those considered responsible.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.sub-title: Amazon on the Brink: Global Impact of Deforestation
programme.desc: Deforestation is ravaging the Amazon. Illegal loggers are destroying wide tracts of forest and massive agricultural corporations are buying up land to develop into farms. Scientists warn we are fast approaching a tipping point beyond which the forest's collapse will be irreversible. If this happens, they say there will be serious consequences on global climate and food supply. We talk to experts about the last-ditch efforts to save the world's largest rainforest and what we can do to play our part. Guests: Ito Akihiko (Professor, The University of Tokyo) Fuma Kenji (CEO, Neural)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: First broadcast on December 14, 2023. In the late 19th century, writer Lafcadio Hearn (Japanese name: Koizumi Yakumo) helped introduce Japan to the wider world. We visit the Izumo area to learn about the supernatural realm that he loved.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Japan Railway Journal
programme.desc: A recent design trend on the rise is the use of traditional craftsmanship in railway cars, from tourist trains to commuter vehicles. See how this design trend is transforming Japan's trains.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: Akita's Festivals Light Up Long Winters
programme.desc: The city of Senboku in Akita Prefecture is made up of three towns: Tazawako, which has the deepest lake in Japan; Nishiki, home to farming scenery: and Kakunodate, called the little Kyoto of Tohoku. In addition to the stunning nature and samurai culture, visitors can enjoy spectacles related to the Lunar New Year. Catrina Sugita experiences the area's winter lifestyle and its fiery festivals.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: DEEPER LOOK
programme.sub-title: The Global Rise of Japanese Literature: Tejima Yuki, Literary Translator
programme.desc: Why is Japanese literature gaining international acclaim? Tejima Yuki, literary translator of "Totto-chan, The Sequel," shares her view.

programme.title: Dig More Japan
programme.desc: Japan has long had a special relationship with dogs, a relationship that's still evolving. Lets dig a little deeper. The segments featured in this episode are available in full online at NHK WORLD-JAPAN ON DEMAND. *Please note that due to the available terms of the video, some of the links may be expired.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef Mini
programme.desc: Dining with the Chef Mini introduces traditional techniques and resourceful recipes in just 5 minutes! Chefs Saito and Rika present their unique approaches to cooking delicious Japanese food. In this episode, chef Rika will show you a plating technique for noodles using soba, buckwheat noodles topped with meat. Join us and learn how to make an original meaty buckwheat noodle dish at home!

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.sub-title: Rika's TOKYO CUISINE: Pork Ginger Rice Burger
programme.desc: Learn about easy, delicious and healthy cooking with Chef Rika! Featured recipes: (1) Pork Ginger Rice Burger (2) Japanese-style Coleslaw.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Reinterpreting Rakugo from a Woman's Perspective: Hayashiya Tsuruko / Rakugo Storyteller
programme.desc: Hayashiya Tsuruko is breaking new ground by reinterpreting the Japanese art of classic rakugo comic storytelling from a woman's perspective. She talks about her message for modern audiences.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: "Curry rice," one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: National Parks of Japan
programme.desc: Daisen-Oki National Park comprises islands and a mainland area with a coast and mountain range. Home to shrines and sacred mountains, it's been the setting of Japanese myths. Join us on a cruise with spectacular sights and a trek across the mainland, where we observe a daily morning ritual at Miho Shrine and climb the majestic Mt. Daisen.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: A dapper young man sits in a teahouse with his older companion when a young woman catches his eye. From the way they're looking at each other, it's clear that there's something going on between them.

programme.title: Japan in Focus
programme.desc: To place a greater focus on their careers, women in Japan are increasingly using egg freezing to save pregnancy for later in their lives, accepting the cost and physical strain that treatment entails.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.sub-title: An Everyday Family Diner in Tokyo
programme.desc: At a family diner, we meet customers of all ages, from solo diners to families and big groups. These diners' stories may seem ordinary, but all kinds of quiet dramas lie within these everyday moments.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: The Dream of Generative AI Engineering - Koji Nishiguchi, Nagoya University
programme.desc: Research is ongoing to apply 3D generative AI to structural design. Koji Nishiguchi of Nagoya University is on the frontline, with a simulation method which used to be thought of as impractical.

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS
programme.desc: Mongolia's culture of meat-eating is contributing to health problems in this developing economy. Chef Suzuki Yuko aims to introduce more vegetables through workshops and improved hospital menus.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Walnuts have long been valued in Japan. In a major production area, join a wild harvest using bamboo poles and recreate an ancient meal. Back in Tokyo, enjoy walnut dishes at a renowned restaurant. Reporter: Kailene Falls
